title: Aluminum starts the year on a bullish note
summary: Aluminum prices have surpassed $3,000 per ton on the Comex and LME exchanges, driven by reduced output and inventory levels in China and Europe due to capacity caps and high electricity costs. U.S. Comex listed aluminum at $3,050.75 per metric ton before trading on Jan. 5, up 1.6%, while LME showed $3,015.50 per ton. Demand from construction and renewables remains strong, with LME inventories declining significantly in November 2025.

title: Aluminum Hits 3-year High
summary: Aluminum prices reached 2999.00 USD/T, the highest since April 2022, with a 3.64% gain over the past four weeks and 18.54% increase in the last 12 months. On January 2, 2026, prices rose to 3,023.10 USD/T, up 0.91% from the previous day. The market shows bullish trends amid supply concerns.

title: Aluminum price hits $3,000 for first time since 2022 on supply concern
summary: Aluminum prices climbed above $3,000 per ton for the first time in over three years, reaching $3,015.50 on the LME amid tightening supply from Chinese capacity caps and European production constraints due to high electricity prices. Global inventories are declining while demand from construction and renewables stays robust. Futures rallied 17% last year, the most since 2021.

title: Aluminium Price Spikes Driven by Global Supply Concerns in 2026
summary: London Metal Exchange aluminum futures hit $3,008 per tonne in January 2026, breaking above $3,000 for the first time since mid-2022. The spike is attributed to global supply constraints affecting production.

title: Aluminum prices top $3,000 for the first time since 2022 as supply risks grow
summary: Aluminum prices have exceeded $3,000 per ton for the first time since 2022, fueled by growing supply risks including production limits in China and Europe.

title: Aluminum starts the year on a bullish note
summary: Aluminum prices have surpassed $3,000 per ton on U.S. and European exchanges, with the Comex exchange listing aluminum at $3,050.75 per metric ton. Supply-side factors driving the price increase include declining output in China due to government-imposed smelting capacity caps and production constraints in Europe from high electricity prices, while demand from construction and renewable sectors remains robust.

title: Year-End Aluminum Ingot Inventory Alert Sounded! Domestic Inventory Buildup in Q1 2026 a Foregone Conclusion
summary: Chinese aluminum production increased 1.9% year-over-year in December with new capacity coming online in Inner Mongolia and Xinjiang. Despite high aluminum prices, domestic inventory is expected to build throughout Q1 2026, with projections showing inventory reaching around 730,000 metric tons by end-January, potentially restraining aluminum price momentum.

title: Vedanta's Q3 Production SMASHES Records: Aluminium, Alumina, Zinc Output Soars
summary: Vedanta Ltd. achieved record-breaking third-quarter aluminum production at 620 kilotonnes (up 1% year-over-year) and alumina production at 794 kilotonnes (up 57% year-over-year). These gains were driven by the commissioning of Train II at the Lanjigarh refinery and operational efficiencies at the Jharsuguda facility.

title: LME aluminium cash climbs to $2,985.5/t as opening stocks ease 0.49% to 509,250t
summary: LME aluminum cash prices reached $2,985.5 per tonne as warehouse inventory declined to 509,250 tonnes. The 3-month contract strengthened to $3,010 per tonne, with December 2026 futures also showing gains of approximately 1.10 percent.

title: Aluminum price hits $3,000 for first time since 2022 on supply concern
summary: Aluminum climbed above $3,000 per ton for the first time in over three years, driven by a tightening supply outlook and strong long-term demand expectations. A cap on Chinese smelting capacity and European production constraints from high electricity prices have reduced global inventories, while construction and renewable energy sectors maintain robust demand.

title: ALUMINIUM 2026: Pioneering Sustainability and Innovation
summary: The global aluminum industry will converge at ALUMINIUM 2026, held October 6–8 in Düsseldorf, Germany, focusing on sustainability, innovation, and collaboration. The event highlights secondary aluminum's role in decarbonization, advancements in metal processing, recycling, casting, automation, and surface finishing. New features include Hall 7A for semi-finished products, an expanded ALUMINIUM Conference, and a Sustainability & Recycling Conference.

title: Aerosol can features Elysis primary aluminum, recycled content
summary: Alcoa, Ball, and Unilever have partnered to create an aerosol can using 50% Elysis carbon-free primary aluminum and 50% postconsumer recycled content, marking the first use of this technology in consumer packaging. Elysis, a joint venture between Alcoa and Rio Tinto, employs inert anode technology to eliminate direct greenhouse gas emissions from smelting by producing oxygen instead of CO₂. This collaboration demonstrates low-carbon innovation across the aluminum value chain to meet decarbonization goals.

title: Aluminium's unifying approach to net-zero transformation
summary: Alcoa and Rio Tinto are demonstrating Elysis zero-carbon smelting technology industrially, while Alcoa pioneers mechanical vapour recompression to reduce alumina refining emissions. Emirates Global Aluminium's CelestiAL uses solar power to lower production carbon intensity, and the industry is advancing recycling and clean energy investments. These efforts position aluminum as a key sustainable metal for net-zero across applications like EVs and renewable infrastructure.

title: ALUMINIUM 2026: Driving Innovation for a Sustainable Future
summary: ALUMINIUM 2026 emphasizes sustainability, particularly secondary aluminum for decarbonization, alongside topics like metal processing, primary production, recycling, automation, casting, and surface finishing. Supported by Aluminium Deutschland and European Aluminium, the event features themed pavilions and serves as a platform for collaboration and innovation. It showcases aluminum's recyclability as a driver for sustainable industries in mobility, construction, and manufacturing.

title: [CES Innovation Awards® 2026 Honoree] Portable SSD T7 Resurrected
summary: Samsung's Portable SSD T7 Resurrected, a CES Innovation Awards 2026 honoree, features a 100% recycled aluminum design using waste from smartphone production. This cross-division project advances Samsung's circular-design strategy by reusing materials from smartphones, appliances, and computers. It integrates technology, design, and environmental considerations to expand a sustainable ecosystem.

title: The more sustainability and transparency, the better the decisions
summary: Speira utilizes advanced technologies and AI in recycling to champion transparency and sustainability, focusing on carbon footprint reduction. Their RIVOS products combine external scrap and low-carbon primary metal, tailored to regional sustainable energy, maximizing efficiency and minimizing emissions. This third-party certified approach helps customers select sustainable aluminum closer to net zero.

title: HRC Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: HRC Steel decreased to 874.00 USD/T, hitting a 5-week low, down from 940 USD/T on January 2, 2026. Over the past month, prices rose 3.75%, and year-over-year up 32.77%. Forecasts predict trading at 961.44 USD/T by quarter-end and 1031.93 in 12 months.

title: Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Steel fell to 3,096 CNY/T on December 31, 2025, down 0.32% daily, 0.45% monthly, and 5.70% year-over-year. Steel rebar futures are set to drop 7% in 2025 amid soft demand, though recent climbs to CNY 3,080 per tonne reflect improving profitability expectations.

title: PRICE INCREASE ANNOUNCEMENT - January 5, 2026
summary: Domestic steel mills announced sharp price increases for all January 2026 orders across all markets. The hikes are driven by various market factors pressuring steel pricing.

title: U.S. Steelmakers Prep for $1.6 Billion in 1Q Project Starts
summary: U.S. steelmakers, including U.S. Steel and Cleveland-Cliffs, are preparing over $1.6 billion in steel-manufacturing projects set to begin construction in Q1 2026 to expand capacity amid rising demand. Key projects include the restart of Furnace B at U.S. Steel's Granite City Steel Works in Illinois and Cleveland-Cliffs' replacement of furnaces at Butler Steel Works in Pennsylvania. Nippon Steel, U.S. Steel's parent, commits to no closures or idlings before 2035.

title: Korea steel industry faces triple hit from structural slump, tariffs, and ...
summary: Korea's steel industry anticipates ongoing challenges in 2026 due to structural downturns, tariff burdens, and weak demand in real estate and construction. Cumulative crude steel production from January to November 2025 was 56.1 million tons, down 3.7% year-over-year, potentially reaching the lowest in 15 years. Experts highlight a mismatch between production capacity and demand in both domestic and export markets.

title: EU's carbon border tax on heavy industry goods goes into effect ...
summary: The EU's Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM) takes effect on January 1, 2026, requiring steel and aluminium exporters to pay for CO2 emissions linked to their production. This aims to protect EU manufacturers from less stringent foreign regulations but risks trade escalation and higher costs for importers. Revenues from CBAM, projected at €1.5 billion by 2028, will fund support for affected industries.

title: Overcapacity, China focuses on controlling steel production
summary: China plans to maintain strict control over crude steel production during 2026-2030 to address overcapacity issues. This policy reaffirms government efforts to manage supply amid global concerns about excess steel output.

title: Blastr Green Steel's Strategic Water Innovation with Ecolab - AInvest
summary: Blastr Green Steel partners with Ecolab to redefine water management in ultra-low CO₂ steel production, offering a blueprint for decarbonizing heavy industries. The collaboration reduces water and energy use, aligns with EU climate goals like CBAM, and enhances ESG credentials. It demonstrates how sustainability can drive profitability in the green steel race.

title: L&T wins Orders (Major*) for Minerals & Metals Business
summary: Larsen & Toubro's Minerals & Metals business secures major orders from Steel Authority of India (SAIL) for expanding IISCO Steel Plant capacity from 2.5 MTPA to 6.5 MTPA. The package includes engineering, procurement, and installation for Coke Oven Battery, By-Product Plant, Basic Oxygen Furnace, and material handling. This supports India's steel manufacturing through innovation, capacity augmentation, and sustainable development.

title: Advancing Electric Smelting for Sustainable Iron Production: Pilot-Scale Validation of Controlled Open-Arc DC Technology by Metix Pty Ltd
summary: A feature article discusses advancing electric smelting technology for sustainable iron production. It covers pilot-scale validation of controlled open-arc DC technology by Metix Pty Ltd. This innovation aims to enhance sustainability in iron and steelmaking processes.

title: Chile's Mantoverde Copper Mine Strike, LME Copper Fluctuated and Closed Lower Last Friday - SMM Copper Morning Meeting Minutes
summary: Union #2 at Capstone Copper's Mantoverde copper mine in Chile commenced strike action on January 2, affecting 22% of the workforce and reducing operations to about 30% of normal production. The company remains open to negotiations. LME copper futures fluctuated and closed lower at $12,460.5/mt, down 0.29%.

title: Shanghai copper kicks off 2026 strong on supply jitters
summary: Shanghai copper opened the year strongly due to intensified supply concerns from a strike at a Chilean mine. The most-active copper contract rose amid these jitters. This reflects broader market sensitivity to production disruptions.

title: Capstone Copper (ASX:CSC) Drops on Chile Strike
summary: Capstone Copper's shares fell 4% to A$14.51 following a strike by workers at its Mantoverde mine in Chile starting January 2, 2026. The strike impacts operations at this key copper facility. This event highlights vulnerabilities in copper supply chains.

title: Southern Copper Corporation's Decade-Long Copper Production Growth Strategy: Strategic Capital Deployment and Long-Term Scalability
summary: Southern Copper is advancing projects like Tia Maria despite delays from protests, mobilizing 1,900 workers to bolster Peru's copper production. The $2.6 billion Los Chancas project faces illegal mining challenges but is set to start in 2030-2031, adding significant output. These efforts support long-term capacity expansion.

title: On January 5, the SMM #1 refined nickel price was ...
summary: The SMM #1 refined nickel price on January 5 stood at 133700-142600 yuan/mt, with an average price of 138150 yuan/mt. This marks an increase of 600 yuan/mt from the previous day. The report highlights the latest spot pricing trends in the nickel market.

title: Nickel price extends rebound after Indonesia signals mine output cut
summary: Nickel prices on the LME rose 0.7% to $14,750 a ton, extending gains over 3% from an eight-month low following Indonesia's proposal to cut nickel ore production to 250 million tons in 2026 from 379 million tons this year. The reduction addresses a slump in prices amid oversupply from Indonesia and China outpacing demand. Analysts predict nickel will outperform other base metals in 2026 if the cut proceeds.

title: [SMM Nickel Midday Review] Nickel Prices Rise Slightly on January 5, South Korean President Lee Jae-myung Makes First Visit to China
summary: Nickel prices rose slightly on January 5 according to the SMM midday review. The update coincides with South Korean President Lee Jae-myung's first visit to China. This reflects ongoing market movements in nickel amid regional developments.

title: Nickel's New Era: Rising Prices, Growing EV Demand, and Major Projects Moving Forward
summary: The nickel market is shifting due to Indonesia's supply management, driving prices from $14,200 to $16,500 per ton since mid-December 2025, with projections up to $18,500-$20,000. Policies include shorter mining licenses, mine closures, and bans on new processing plants, countering prior surpluses. North American projects and EV demand signal stronger conditions for 2026.

title: Nickel reaches 14-month high following Vale Indonesia's halt to mining
summary: Nickel prices reached a 14-month high of $16,945 per metric ton on the London Metal Exchange after Vale Indonesia suspended mining operations due to a delay in approving its 2026 annual production plan. The company expects approval soon and states it won't disrupt overall operations. This surge follows Indonesia's announcement to cut nickel ore production by a third by 2026 to support prices amid prior oversupply.

title: Vale Indonesia Paused Nickel Mining While Waiting On 2026 Permits
summary: PT Vale Indonesia has paused nickel mining operations while awaiting Indonesian government approval for its 2026 production plan. The smelter organization FINI anticipates nickel demand to reach 340-350 million metric tons by 2026, up 50 million from the previous year. Regulatory approvals are significantly influencing nickel market dynamics.

title: Nickel Higher on Mine Suspension
summary: Nickel prices rose 1.6% to $16,910 per ton, breaking 14-month highs following the suspension of Vale Indonesia's mine. This follows Indonesia's government announcement to cut nickel ore output by a third in 2026 and reduce mining quotas to support prices. The move addresses ongoing oversupply pressures in the market.

title: Sphere joins Nickel Industries ENC move in Indonesia
summary: Sphere has joined Nickel Industries' ENC move in Indonesia, signaling new developments in nickel operations or investments. This activity occurs amid rising nickel prices and production adjustments in the region. Details on the specific collaboration or capacity implications remain limited in the report.

title: Nickel Supply Woes: Innovations Steering a Sustainable EV Future
summary: The article discusses challenges in nickel supply for high-nickel NMC batteries amid surging demand from China, the US, and EU. It highlights innovations like LFP batteries, sodium-ion batteries, battery recycling, and smaller batteries to reduce nickel dependency and promote sustainability. Alaska Energy Metals Corporation is advancing sustainable nickel sourcing through its Nikolai project in Alaska.

title: Harvesting the world's greenest nickel
summary: Metalplant in Albania uses phytomining with hyperaccumulating plants like Odontarrhena decipiens to extract nickel while absorbing CO2 through magnesium-rich olivine minerals. This carbon-negative process produces HyperNickel for EV batteries and green steel, combined with carbon removal credits as NegativeNickel. The technology accelerates natural processes for sustainable nickel production.

title: Nickel's role in the future of safer electric vehicle batteries
summary: Researchers from The University of Texas at Austin and Argonne National Laboratory analyzed high-nickel cathodes, which offer higher energy density for longer EV ranges but face stability issues. The study identifies critical states of charge based on metal-oxygen bonds and surface reactivity to enhance thermal stability and safety. These findings provide a roadmap for safer, efficient EV batteries.

title: Mining with integrity to advance sustainable nickel downstreaming
summary: The article covers a company's commitment to sustainable nickel production through emission reductions. It aims to cut emissions by 33% by 2030 and reduce carbon intensity of nickel products by up to 50%. This supports ethical mining and downstream processing for sustainability.

title: Tenaris Acquires isOplus Oil and Gas Division in $10M Deal, Expands Pipe Coating Business
summary: Tenaris has acquired the oil and gas division of isOplus for $10 million, gaining ownership of pre-insulated pipeline systems for district heating and anti-corrosion coatings in Europe. The acquired business unit has been rebranded as Tenaris Coating Italy, focusing on anti-corrosion coatings for oil and gas pipelines applied at Tenaris facilities in Italy, Mexico, Argentina, and Brazil. This strategic move aims to reduce delivery times, ensure quality standards, lower logistical costs, and minimize environmental impact, as stated by Andrea Previtali, Vice President Line Pipe and Process at Tenaris.

title: Repurchased own ordinary shares reached 5% of Tenaris's voting rights; Tenaris's controlling shareholder files amendment to Schedule 13D
summary: Tenaris's controlling shareholders, San Faustin S.A. and Techint Holdings S.à r.l., filed an amendment to their Schedule 13D with the U.S. SEC, disclosing share repurchase activities and a new accelerated share disposal program. The program involves selling up to 21 million ordinary shares from December 15, 2025, to May 19, 2026, through a European financial institution, with all trading decisions made independently. Tenaris is described as a leading global supplier of steel tubes for the energy industry.

title: Tenaris S A : Weekly Report (December 29, 2025 – January 2, 2026) on the Share Buyback Program
summary: Under its Second Tranche of the USD1.2 billion Share Buyback Program, Tenaris repurchased 3,320,025 ordinary shares from December 29, 2025, to January 2, 2026, for approximately USD64.2 million. As of January 2, 2026, the company holds 62,328,172 treasury shares, equating to 5.81% of total issued share capital, with plans to cancel them in due course. Details of the transactions are available on Tenaris's investor relations website.
